data.title: Great drinks, food, and service
data.text: The service is great and the food and drinks are wonderful. I recommend this restaurant to many family and friends when they are in the area.

data.title: Newer location, in bad shape
data.text: We walked in and were greeted with terrible looking tables and chairs. Booths looked worn out also. Food taste was below average. Drinks weren't good. We won't go back.

data.title: My Favorite Mexican Food Restaurant
data.text: Love the food here. Good prices and delicious lunch buffet. I also enjoy there chili relleno. My wife always orders their Half Super Tostado which is a meal in itself. Highly recommended for all occasions.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Love this restaurant, food is fresh and authentic, portions are big, they make the best rice and beans, their food is just delicious.... servers are attentive and friendly

data.title: Our first time there
data.text: Our favorite was closed for the night, so the couple we were with (they were driving) brought us here.  Food was very good.  Waiter command of English was average bad.  Maybe a bit pricy, but perhaps not to you.  We had a bottle of wine too.  Nice building inside.

data.title: Mole
data.text: Mi Guadalajara is a very large restaurant, they can hide just about any size group and the place is not loud. Service is Good, and very local and seams like family. The drinks and the food portions are LARGE, come with a big apatite.  The Mole was two large thigh or leg meat? Could not tell. The mole has a bit of a kick. Love it.

data.title: Mariachi music on friday night
data.text: Went on a friday night to celebrate with family.  The traveling mariachi group played almost constantly.  Sometimes too loud to hold a conversation.  Food was excellent!! service good too.

data.title: Best Chili Rellenos I've had
data.text: Another excellent and economical eating place in Escondido.  Great service, great variety and superb ambience - real Mexican.  Enjoy a beer with your dinner, or from the smorgasborg.

data.title: Still Great!
data.text:
Took my lady to Mi Guadalajara yesterday for Mother's Day Mimosa Brunch.  We got there about 845am (the brunch started at 9am), and there were already 75 people outside waiting!  So we joined them, and in no time, the doors opened and we walked in. We waited about 10-15 minutes before being escorted to our table.  Our server brought us 2 mimosas!

The food was all very good and filling, from the fresh fruit and breads to the freshly made tacos and custom omelettes, to the tasty desserts and ice cream.  The service was outstanding!

Definitely will return to Mi Guadalajara!

data.title: Great place for Lunch
data.text:
The décor is really awesome. We go there mostly for lunch or happy hour. I have always found the service friendly and fast. They have a lunch buffet for $10.95 and a lunch menu. The Perfect Margarita is really good, and the Cheese Crisp is so yummy.
I only been for dinner a few times, and I'm not crazy about it because it is so busy and crowded and the noise level is really too much. Very hard to have a conversation at your table.

data.title: Food just ok, service slow.
data.text: We've dine here a few times and the food just seems ok. The beans and rice definitely not authentic and the rest of the food just "meh". Once while dining in the bar there was a bad sewage smell and they didn't seem bothered. Saw some not so clean things in the bar area. Not worth the price for us and we are Escondido residents. Many other better choices.

data.title: Not a great meal but very good decor.
data.text: I have never been too impressed with their cooking at this place. Service is good, and it's nice looking inside but the food is pretty predictable and nothing out of the ordinary. Wish I had better news!

data.title: Not Your Everyday Mexican Restaurant
data.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Escondido. I love the unique decor and building. Food is always top notch and plentiful. Come on the weekend for live mariachi music. Main dining area is lively and fun.

data.title: Recommended by a local
data.text: We had just checked into our place where we were staying near Escondido.  While at a local store we asked a store employee for a restaurant suggestion.  She immediately recommended Mi Guadalajara.   It was very good.  The customers appeared to be locals and the prices were very reasonable.  I had carnitas and my wife had fajitas.  Both were very good.  The service was attentive. The margaritas were large and according to my wife, they were very good.  The beers were primarily Mexican beers which was appropriate.  There was even a mariachi band playing among the varied dining rooms.   Overall, we would recommend the Mi Guadalajara for lunch or dinner when in Escondido.

data.title: Be careful! Especially with large groups!
data.text:
Had eight adults and two kids - the receipt showed eleven people with automatic gratuity added. We all split entrees, too. Food came out from three different people, at different times, and we still had to wait for silverware and plates. 

Margaritas were incredibly watered down, and food was not very good.. Despite having a large group and someone celebrating a birthday,  the mariachi band singing to the next table ignored us. 

Not a pleasant experience, and I've been to this restaurant many times..because of having family present, it was not possible to speak with a manager. I called the next day and the manager used profanity to basically say, "too bad." When calling back, the hostess said to hang up because they need the line open for customers. 

A horrible experience, so please avoid!!

data.title: Looks good from outside....
data.text: .... but we thought it was one of the worst Mexican dinners we ever had.  Right from the start, the tortilla chips were greasy and tasteless, so was the salsa.  My husband asked for some spicy sauces, no particular brands, just whatever they might have - there was none on the table, which is unusual for a Mexican restaurant.  It took the waiter forever to bring one bottle of tapatio - we were almost done with dinner when it came.  My carne asada was soaked in grease, my son's enchilada was terribly salty and my husband, well, hardly touched his carnitas - dry and salty.  Too bad because that restaurant looks like a pretty hacienda from outside.

data.title: Very, very good!
data.text:
We ate Dinner at Mi Guadalajara last night.  Been there many times before, and it's always good.  Last night was no exception.  It took us awhile to get seated as the hostess finally appeared and apologized, saying she was training someone.  Once seated, we were given menus and asked for our drink orders. She brought us a Pacifico and a pina colada, and took our orders.  We both ordered 2 item combinations: a beef burrito and a beef enchilada for me, and my gf ordered.a chicken enchilada and a chili relleno.

It was fairly crowded, but our food arrived quickly!  Both meals were served piping hot, with rice and refried beans.  Both my burrito and enchilada were delicious, as were the rice and beans.  I cleared my plate in no time (with help from another cold Pacifico).   My gf was unable to finish her meal so I helped myself to a couple bites of her chili relleno (m-m-m).  I know she liked it because the only thing she complained about was how big it was!  She was able to take it home and had it for lunch today.

The interior of Mi Guadalajara is circular, and decorated tastefully,  Also check their full menu of seafood, steaks, appetizers and house specialties.   We also went late last year for their Sunday champagne brunch. Outstanding!!  Love Mi Guadalajara!

data.title: Good Food, Good Service
data.text: We had a party of 9 and the service was very good. Orders were taken, drinks were served along with Chips and Salsa. Our orders ranged from Kids Berger and Fries to Carne Asada Guadalajara . Everyone said the food was good. The Margaritas were a little weak.

data.title: Good Food & Atmosphere
data.text:
We were lucky to arrive during happy hour 3:00-7:00 M-F. 1/2 priced appetizers and discounted drinks😊

The chicken fajita quesadilla appetizer was more than enough to eat as a meal. My husband had the combo enchilada and taco. Both were great. Sat outside. Not a great patio but it worked!

Would come here again!!

data.title: Great food, waiter needs help
data.text:
My wife and I went to Mi Guadalajara on April 16, 2015 after reading reviews on TA. Everything posted is true. It is a beautiful restaurant with colorful decorations. The food was extremely good. We went during happy hour so we decided to enjoy some discounted appetizers and drinks. I asked the waiter about the happy hour prices. He either did not know, did not care, or was too lazy to get us a menu. He just said that everything is about 30-40% off. Umm? We ordered two regular margaritas, fiesta Guadalajara nachos, and carnitas nachos. The food dishes were excellent. But, the margaritas were watered down and the glasses had more ice than liquid. When we got our bill, the food dishes were indeed 50% off of regular price. These prices are an awesome value. But, because the waiter would not tell us how much they were going to be, we were still a little anxious. Our bill included a charge for large margaritas with a small discount. We clearly ordered and received regular size. I asked the waiter about the charge. He said that the ones we had were large. No way. There were larger glasses on a few tables around us. I told him I don’t think so, but he insisted. I do not like being lied too.  
I hope the manager or owner reads this posting. At a minimum, this waiter needs to receive additional training or be put on probation. There is no place in the restaurant business for lazy and “less than truthful” employees. According to our ticket, the server is 2006 FAB. Now I know why he never introduced himself in the beginning of the meal.
